history.proof: intros. unfold divp in *. unfold ppcp. unfold canonical. exfalso. shelve.

exceptions.tactic: intros a b c H1 H2.

exceptions.exn: Cannot find a relation to rewrite.

In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) a, b, c : poly A0 eqA ltM H : (let (x, x0) := a in match x as l return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a a0 end x end x0) b H0 : (let (x, x0) := a in match x as l return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a a0 end x end x0) c Unable to unify "eqP ?M2194 ?M2197 ?M2205 (spminusf ?M2194 ?M2195 ?M2196 ?M2197 ?M2199 ?M2200 ?M2201 ?M2202 ?M2204 ?M2205 ?M2206 ?M2207 ?M2209 ?M2210 ?M2211 ?M2212 ?M2213) (spminusf ?M2194 ?M2195 ?M2196 ?M2197 ?M2199 ?M2200 ?M2201 ?M2202 ?M2204 ?M2205 ?M2206 ?M2207 ?M2209 ?M2210 ?M2211 (pX ?M2209 ?M2212) (pX ?M2210 ?M2213))" with "(let (x, x0) := a in match x as l return (olist (A:=A) ltM l /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : olist (A:=A) ltM nil /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : olist (A:=A) ltM (a :: l) /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (olist (A:=A) ltM l0 /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : olist (A:=A) ltM nil /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : olist (A:=A) ltM (a0 :: l0) /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a a0 end x end x0) ((let (x, x0) := b in match x as l return (olist (A:=A) ltM l /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> poly A0 eqA ltM) with | nil => fun (H'0 : olist (A:=A) ltM nil /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => exist (fun a : list (Term A n) => olist (A:=A) ltM a /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) a) (pO A n) H'0 | a :: l => fun (H'0 : olist (A:=A) ltM (a :: l) /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (olist (A:=A) ltM l0 /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) l0 -> poly A0 eqA ltM) with | nil => fun H'2 : olist (A:=A) ltM nil /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) nil => exist (fun a0 : list (Term A n) => olist (A:=A) ltM a0 /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) a0) (pO A n) H'2 | a0 :: l0 => fun H'2 : olist (A:=A) ltM (a0 :: l0) /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) (a0 :: l0) => exist (fun a1 : list (Term A n) => olist (A:=A) ltM a1 /\\ nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) a1) (ppc A1 (n:=n) a a0 :: pO A n) (canonicalp1 A A0 eqA n ltM (ppc A1 (n:=n) a a0) (ppc_nZ A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA cs n a a0 a0 (canonical_nzeroP A A0 eqA n ltM a l H'0) (canonical_nzeroP A A0 eqA n ltM a0 l0 H'2))) end x end x0) c)".

In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) a, b, c : poly A0 eqA ltM H : (let (x, x0) := a in match x as l return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a a0 end x end x0) b H0 : (let (x, x0) := a in match x as l return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a a0 end x end x0) c Unable to unify "(let (x, x0) := a in match x as l return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA n a a0 end x end x0) b" with "False".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall a b c : poly A0 eqA ltM, divp a b -> divp a c -> divp a (ppcp b c)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
divp = fun H' : poly A0 eqA ltM => let (x, x0) := H' in match x as l return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l -> poly A0 eqA ltM -> Prop) with | nil => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil) (_ : poly A0 eqA ltM) => False | a :: l => fun (_ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a :: l)) (H'1 : poly A0 eqA ltM) => let (x0, x) := H'1 in match x0 as l0 return (canonical A0 eqA ltM l0 -> Prop) with | nil => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM nil => False | a0 :: l0 => fun _ : canonical A0 eqA ltM (a0 :: l0) => divP A A0 eqA multA divA

Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope

eqTerm_spminusf_com : forall (A : Type) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> eqP A eqA n (spminusf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec a c nZc p q) (spminusf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec b c nZc p q)

canonical_reduceplus : forall (A : Type) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA -> forall (eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}) (n : nat) (ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop) (ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}), OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) ->...-> canonical A0 eqA ltM q

```  
intros.
intros a b c H1 H2.
unfold divp in *.
destruct H1 as [a1 a2].
destruct H2 as [a3 a4].
unfold ppcp.
unfold divp.
simpl.
exists (pX a1 b a3).
unfold canonical.
split.
- rewrite <- H0. apply spminusf_extend; assumption.
- unfold canonical in a4.
destruct a4.
+ exfalso. apply H. assumption.
+ assumption.
```

original: intros. intros a b c H1 H2. unfold divp in *. destruct H1 as [a1 a2]. destruct H2 as [a3 a4]. unfold ppcp. unfold divp. simpl. exists (pX a1 b a3). unfold canonical. split. - rewrite <- H0. apply spminusf_extend; auto. - unfold canonical in a4. destruct a4. + exfalso. apply H. auto. + auto.
